SEARCH
Package chess

Class Gameboard

java.lang.Object
chess.Gameboard
public class Gameboard extends Object
The GameBoard class represents a chess game board with pieces in their starting positions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Gameboard()
    Initializes the chess game board by placing all the pieces in their starting positions.

  • Method Details

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      Moves a piece from the specified source square to the specified destination square on the game board.
      Parameters:
      fromRow - the row index of the source square
      fromCol - the column index of the source square
      toRow - the row index of the destination square
      toCol - the column index of the destination square
      Returns:
      true if the move is successfully executed, false otherwise

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(Color currentPlayer)
      Determines whether the specified color is in check on the game board.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the color to check for check
      Returns:
      true if the specified color is in check, false otherwise

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate(Color currentPlayer)
      Determines whether the specified color is in checkmate on the game board.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the color to check for checkmate
      Returns:
      true if the specified color is in checkmate, false otherwise

    • promotionDialog

      public Piece promotionDialog(Color color, int row, int col)
      Prompts the user to choose a piece to promote a pawn to and returns the promoted piece.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the pawn being promoted
      row - the row of the pawn being promoted
      col - the column of the pawn being promoted
      Returns:
      the piece that the pawn is being promoted to

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the game board.

    • findKing

      public int[] findKing(Color color)
      Finds the position of the king of the specified color on the game board.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the king to find
      Returns:
      the position of the king of the specified color, or null if not found

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved(int row, int col)
      Checks if a piece at the specified row and column has been moved before.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the piece
      col - the column index of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the piece has been moved before, false otherwise

    • setMoved

      public void setMoved(int row, int col)
      Sets the hasMoved flag for the piece at the specified row and column to true.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the piece
      col - the column index of the piece

    • getPieceAt

      public Piece getPieceAt(int row, int col)
      Get the Piece at a specified row and column index.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - col index
      Returns:
      Piece at location, null if empty

    • setPieceAt

      public void setPieceAt(Piece piece, int row, int col)
      Sets the specified piece at the given row and column on the chess board.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to set on the board
      row - the row index where the piece is to be placed
      col - the column index where the piece is to be placed

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Color getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the current player of the game.
      Returns:
      the color of the current player

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(Color color)
      Sets the current player of the game to the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to set as the current player

    • getEnemyAttackSquares

      public Set<Integer> getEnemyAttackSquares(Color playerColor)
      Returns a set of all squares on the board that are currently being attacked by the enemy pieces of the specified player color.
      Parameters:
      playerColor - the color of the player whose enemy attacks are being checked
      Returns:
      a set of integers representing the squares being attacked by the enemy pieces

    • isSquareAttacked

      public boolean isSquareAttacked(int row, int col, Color color)
      Returns true if the given square on the board is being attacked by a piece of the given color.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the square to check
      col - the column of the square to check
      color - the color of the attacking pieces to look for
      Returns:
      true if the square is being attacked, false otherwise

    • getLastMove

      public Move getLastMove()
      Returns the last move made on the game board.
      Returns:
      the last move made on the game board or null if there have been no moves made yet.

    • hasJustDoubleMoved

      public boolean hasJustDoubleMoved(Pawn pawn)
      Determines whether the specified pawn has just double moved.
      Parameters:
      pawn - the pawn to check
      Returns:
      true if the pawn has just double moved, false otherwise.

    • getLastMovedPiece

      public Piece getLastMovedPiece()
      Returns the last piece that was moved on the game board.
      Returns:
      the last piece that was moved on the game board or null if there have been no moves made yet.

    • getJustDoubleMoved

      public Pawn getJustDoubleMoved()
      Returns the pawn that has just double moved.
      Returns:
      the pawn that has just double moved or null if no pawn has just double moved.
